definition: to move by jerks or with a tug
examples: hitching his chair closer to the table

definition: to catch or fasten by or as if by a hook or knot
examples: hitched his horse to the fence post

definition: to connect (a vehicle or implement) with a source of motive power, to attach (a source of motive power) to a vehicle or instrument
examples: hitch a rake to a tractor
hitch the horses to the wagon

definition: to move with halts and jerks : hobble
to become entangled, made fast, or linked

examples: had a hitch in his step

definition: a sudden movement or pull : jerk
a usually unforeseen difficulty or obstacle
examples: The plan went off without a hitch.

definition: the act or fact of catching hold
a connection between a vehicle or implement and a detachable source of power (such as a tractor or horse)
examples: attached a trailer hitch to his pickup

definition: a delimited period especially of military service
examples: serving a four-year hitch in the navy

definition: any of various knots used to form a temporary noose in a line or to secure a line temporarily to an object
